column4: Description
A record of any production issues arising during the session (see Advanced Voice Channel Operations for detailed content)

column3: Contact Center Issue Analysis And Recommended Response
column4: A record of the root cause analysis for recurring issues and suggested remedial action
Tracked activity and performance statistics used to manage the contact center resource assignments and menu configuration
The type of activity that is tracked and analyze (e.g. wait time, average handle time, dropped call ratio, resolution rate)
The task undertaken to address a detected peak load condition
The type of response (e.g. staff reassignment)
Description of the action taken and impact to service performance

Contact Center Operations: CR Contact Center Administrative Plan Instance Record
CR Contact Center Administrative Plan Instance Record
column4: The default contact center operational configuration as defined by Contact Center Management (Note this can include some latitude for position assignment changes to be made during day to day operations by this service domain)

Contact Center Operations: CR Contact Center Administrative Plan Instance Record
column4: Maintains the allocation records of available customer service representatives to the servicing positions defined in the contact center configuration. This includes past and future booking arrangements

Contact Center Operations: CR Contact Center Administrative Plan Instance Record
column4: Reference to a customer servicing representative

Contact Center Operations: CR Contact Center Administrative Plan Instance Record
column4: Details about a registered customer servicing representative

Contact Center Operations: CR Contact Center Administrative Plan Instance Record
column4: Details the qualification, expertise and level of experience of the servicing representative

Contact Center Operations: CR Contact Center Administrative Plan Instance Record
column4: Reference to the locations the customer servicing representative can work from (can include remote working arrangements and time zone availability)

Contact Center Operations: CR Contact Center Administrative Plan Instance Record
column4: Details the time the customer servicing representative plans to be and is actually available for assignments which covers times for shift working and temporary/overtime assignments as may be necessary

Contact Center Operations: CR Contact Center Administrative Plan Instance Record
column4: Tracks the current status indicating availability for assignment to a servicing position (where  the representative will coordinate with contact routing for customer contacts)

Contact Center Operations: CR Contact Center Administrative Plan Instance Record
column4: Reference to a consolidated record of assignments. This is used to track utilization and performance
Reference to the servicing representative
Reference to the assigned servicing position/desk within the contact center
Details any specific properties for the assigned servicing position (e.g. type of product/service covered, required qualifications/certifications/experience)

Planned and actual servicing activity at the position during the session (records inbound contact details and allows for pre-assigned servicing actions e.g. outbound customer contacts for issue resolution/sales)

column3: Customer Contact Session Procedure Instance Reference
column4: Reference to the customer contact record for customer interactions during the servicing session
